techmeme.title: European automakers warn of substantial disruption to production after China cut off Nexperia's outbound shipments following the Dutch seizure of Nexperia (Financial Times)
A look at the challenges facing Europe's chip industry, as the EU will likely fall short of its targeted 20% share of global chip manufacturing by 2030 (Foreign Affairs)
Apple and Formula One announce a five-year US media rights deal for all races, starting in 2026; sources: Apple is paying ~$140M/year, up from ESPN's ~$85M/year (Alex Sherman/CNBC)
Amazon's Twitch begins testing livestream shopping ads allowing users to buy products "in real time", starting with e.l.f. Cosmetics (Peter Adams/Marketing Dive)
Sources: French regulator ACPR is carrying out anti-money laundering checks on Binance and others, as it seeks to determine eligibility for EU MiCA licenses (Claudia Cohen/Bloomberg)
